body.p: Ross Times, the student newspaper of Ross College, printed a "What do you think?" column feature asking: "Do you think that the college is doing enough to provide student parking?" Anyone could mail in a response or use the paper's Web site to respond. In all, 126 answers were received.
This is an example of what type of sample?

response.feedback: Correct. The response was voluntary, since the only responses that were recorded were from students who decided on their own to voice an opinion. This means the survey result could be biased, because it only represents the opinions of those students who, for whatever reason, bothered to write a response, rather than fairly reflecting the opinion of the whole college.

Incorrect. A multistage sample would be when there was more than one level of selection. In this story, there was only a single level of selection, at the level of individual students (who decided to voice an opinion), rather than, for instance, first selecting certain classrooms-full or first selecting certain types of students, such as athletes, or freshmen.
Incorrect. Notice that the students who voiced an opinion were not selected by the newspaper using any randomized method.

Incorrect. Although the survey method was probably relatively convenient for the newspaper, it wasn't a convenience sample, because the students weren't all selected from any certain location that would have happened to suit the needs of the researcher.

body.p: Talkshow host “Bull” Loney asked listeners of his to call in to give their opinion on a topic that he had just spent most of his program ranting about. The station got 384 calls.
This is an example of what type of sample?

response.feedback: Correct. This is a case in which listeners to the show who cared enough about the issue to make the effort to call in were selected.

Incorrect. A multistage sample breaks down the population into successively smaller groups finishing up with a cluster sample or simple random sample. This sample was selected based on listeners to the show who cared enough about the issue to make the effort to call in.

Incorrect. A simple random sample is one in which every member of a group has an equal chance of being selected. This sample was selected based on listeners to the show who cared enough about the issue to make the effort to call in.

Incorrect. A convenience sample is one in which individuals are in the right place at the right time for the convenience of the person conducting the survey. This sample was selected based on listeners to the show who cared enough about the issue to make the effort to call in.
